parts.text: You are a professional marketing content writer. Create engaging, SEO-optimized blog posts with clear structure, compelling headlines, and actionable insights. Always include an engaging title, introduction with hook, 3-4 main sections with H2 subheadings, practical tips, and strong conclusion with call-to-action.
Write a comprehensive 100-200 word blog post about: "{{10.`Processed Text`}}"

Structure requirements:
- Engaging title
- Hook introduction that grabs attention
- 3-4 main sections with clear H2 subheadings
- Actionable insights and practical tips
- Strong conclusion with call-to-action
- SEO-friendly content with natural keyword integration
- Professional yet accessible tone for business audiences

Make it valuable and engaging for readers.

spec.name: file_uri
spec.label: File URI

parts.text: Your system instructions about being a video marketing specialist as well as keep the script short yet subject oriented.
Create a professional 10 second video script about: {{10.`Processed Text`}}

You are a professional video marketing specialist. Create engaging 10 second video.

Your scripts should include:
- Hook (first 2 seconds) - attention-grabbing opening
- Main content (6 seconds) - key points with visual cues
- Call-to-action (2 seconds) - clear next step

Format the script professionally with clear sections and timing markers.

Create a professional 15-30 second video script about: {{10.`Processed Text`}}

Make it engaging, actionable, and conversion-focused for marketing purposes. Include all timing, visual cues, production notes, and optimize for social media platforms.

parts.text: You are a social media marketing expert. Create platform-optimized content that drives engagement. Analyze the user request to determine the best platform approach and adapt content accordingly with appropriate tone, length, hashtag strategy, and call-to-action based on platform best practices. Captions should be short, engaging, punchy and should have emojis (50 - 100 words)where as descriptions for linkedin should be long, professional, minimalistic (100- 200 words)

Create optimized social media content about: "{{10.`Processed Text`}}"

Platform optimization guidelines:
- **LinkedIn:** Professional tone, industry insights, thought leadership, 3-5 business hashtags, 150-300 words
- **Instagram:** Visual-first storytelling, emotional hooks, 8-15 trending hashtags, engaging captions
- **Facebook:** Community-focused, conversation starters, shareable content, 2-3 hashtags, 100-200 words
- **Twitter/X:** Concise under 280 characters, trending topics, 2-3 hashtags, news-worthy angles
- **TikTok:** Casual trendy language, popular hashtags, viral potential concepts
- **General:** Versatile cross-platform content

Include:
- Value-driven main content  
- Relevant hashtags for the platform
- Engagement-focused language

Determine the best platform fit and create appropriate content.

spec.help: You get this from the 'Upload a File' module.
spec.name: file_uri
spec.label: File URI

mapper.text:
🤖 **AI Marketing Assistant - Commands**

I can help you create professional marketing content quickly and easily!

**🎨 Image Generation:**
- "create image of modern office"
- "generate logo for coffee shop"
- "make picture of team meeting"

**📝 Blog Posts:**
- "write blog about digital marketing"
- "create article on productivity tips"
- "blog post about small business growth"

**💼 Social Media Posts:**
- "social media post about leadership"
- "linkedin post about remote work"
- "instagram post about our product"

**🎬 Video Scripts:**
- "create video script about our service"
- "make 60-second video about productivity"
- "video content for social media"

**💡 Tips:**
- Use voice messages for hands-free interaction
- Be specific about your topic and style
- All content is automatically saved to Google Drive

**🚀 Ready to create something amazing?**
Just tell me what you'd like to generate!

Welcome to your AI Marketing Assistant!

I'm here to help you create professional marketing content in seconds. Here's what I can do for you:

Content I Can Generate:

Images - Marketing visuals, logos, graphics
Example: "create image of modern coffee shop"

Blog Posts - SEO-optimized articles (100-200 words)
Example: "write blog about digital marketing trends"

Social Media Posts - Platform-optimized content
Example: "linkedin post about leadership" or "instagram post about our new product"

Video Scripts- Complete 10 second video scripts
Example: "create video script about productivity tips"

How to Use:
- Send text messages or voice notes with your request
- Be specific about your topic and desired style
- You'll receive your content within seconds

Need Help?
Type "help" anytime to see this guide again.

Ready to create your first piece of marketing content? Just tell me what you need!

expect.name: FLACorWAV
expect.label: Uploaded file is neither FLAC nor WAV

expect.name: FLACorWAV
expect.label: Uploaded file is neither FLAC nor WAV

interface.help: Output only. May contain one or more recognition hypotheses (up to the maximum specified in *maxAlternatives*). These alternatives are ordered in terms of accuracy, with the top (first) alternative being the most probable, as ranked by the recognizer.
interface.name: alternatives

spec.help: Output only. Transcript text representing the words that the user spoke.
spec.name: transcript
spec.label: Transcript

spec.help: Output only. The confidence estimate between 0.0 and 1.0. A higher number indicates an estimated greater likelihood that the recognized words are correct. This field is set only for the top alternative of a non-streaming result or, of a streaming result where *isFinal=true*. This field is not guaranteed to be accurate and users should not rely on it to be always provided. The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating *confidence* was not set.
spec.name: confidence
spec.label: Confidence

spec.help: Output only. A list of word-specific information for each recognized word. Note: When enableSpeakerDiarization is true, you will see all the words from the beginning of the audio.
spec.name: words

spec.help:
Output only. Time offset relative to the beginning of the audio, and corresponding to the start of the spoken word. This field is only set if *enableWordTimeOffsets=true* and only in the top hypothesis. This is an experimental feature and the accuracy of the time offset can vary.

A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by '*s*'. Example: "*3.5s*".
spec.name: startTime
spec.label: Start time

spec.help:
Output only. Time offset relative to the beginning of the audio, and corresponding to the end of the spoken word. This field is only set if *enableWordTimeOffsets=true* and only in the top hypothesis. This is an experimental feature and the accuracy of the time offset can vary.

A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by '*s*'. Example: "*3.5s*".
spec.name: endTime
spec.label: End time

spec.help: Output only. The word corresponding to this set of information.
spec.name: word
spec.label: Word

spec.help: Output only. The confidence estimate between 0.0 and 1.0. A higher number indicates an estimated greater likelihood that the recognized words are correct. This field is set only for the top alternative of a non-streaming result or, of a streaming result where *isFinal=true*. This field is not guaranteed to be accurate and users should not rely on it to be always provided. The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating *confidence* was not set.
spec.name: confidence
spec.label: Confidence

spec.help: Output only. A distinct integer value is assigned for every speaker within the audio. This field specifies which one of those speakers was detected to have spoken this word. Value ranges from '1' to diarizationSpeakerCount. speakerTag is set if enableSpeakerDiarization = 'true' and only in the top alternative.
spec.name: speakerTag
spec.label: Speaker tag
Words

interface.label: Speech Recognition Alternatives

interface.help: For multi-channel audio, this is the channel number corresponding to the recognized result for the audio from that channel. For audioChannelCount = N, its output values can range from '1' to 'N'.
interface.name: channelTag
interface.label: Channel Tag

interface.help: Output only. The [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tag of the language in this result. This language code was detected to have the most likelihood of being spoken in the audio.
interface.name: languageCode
interface.label: Language Code
